title: [transportation] High Employee Turnover Risk in Operations
description: The Operations department has the highest number of employees (14), but the average salary grade is G06, which may indicate lower retention rates due to potential dissatisfaction with compensation. Additionally, the supervisor with the highest number of direct reports (EMP002) may be overstretched, affecting team performance.
recommendations: Review compensation packages for Operations staff
business_impact: Improving employee retention can reduce training costs and improve operational efficiency.

title: [transportation] Concentration Risk in Baggage Handling
description: All baggage handling records (169) are associated with a single origin (ICN) and a single bag type (CHECKED), indicating a lack of diversity in operations. This concentration could pose risks if there are disruptions at the origin airport.
recommendations: Diversify baggage handling operations to include multiple origins
Develop contingency plans for disruptions at ICN
business_impact: Mitigating concentration risks can ensure continuity of operations and reduce potential losses.

title: [transportation] Frequent Minor Delays
description: The average delay time is 10.49 minutes, with a significant number of delays categorized as 'MINIMAL' (23 occurrences). This suggests a pattern of frequent, minor delays that could frustrate passengers and affect overall service quality.
recommendations: Implement process improvements to minimize delays
business_impact: Reducing delays can enhance customer satisfaction and operational efficiency.

title: [transportation] High Parts Cost in Aircraft Maintenance
description: The average parts cost for maintenance is $6965, with some costs reaching up to $125,000. This indicates potential inefficiencies in maintenance processes or reliance on expensive parts.
recommendations: Implement a cost analysis for parts used in maintenance
business_impact: Reducing parts costs can significantly lower overall maintenance expenses and improve profitability.

title: [transportation] High Employee Turnover Risk in Operations
description: The Operations department has the highest number of employees (14), but there is no data on turnover rates. Given the critical nature of operations in transportation, any unaddressed turnover could severely impact service quality.
recommendations: Conduct exit interviews to understand turnover causes
business_impact: High turnover can lead to operational disruptions and increased training costs.

title: [transportation] Concentration Risk in Baggage Handling
description: All baggage handling records show that all bags are checked in as 'CHECKED' and originate from a single airport (ICN). This indicates a lack of diversity in operations, which could pose risks if operations at ICN are disrupted.
recommendations: Expand baggage handling operations to other airports
Develop contingency plans for operations at ICN
business_impact: Over-reliance on a single airport can lead to significant operational risks and service disruptions.

title: [transportation] Frequent Delays with Minimal Compensation
description: The average delay is 10.49 minutes, with a significant number of delays categorized as 'MINIMAL'. However, the average passenger compensation is only 0.04, indicating that passengers may not be adequately compensated for their inconvenience.
recommendations: Enhance communication with passengers during delays
business_impact: Poor compensation practices can lead to customer dissatisfaction and damage the airline's reputation.

title: [transportation] High Maintenance Costs for Aircraft
description: The average parts cost for aircraft maintenance is $6,965, with some costs reaching up to $125,000. This indicates potential inefficiencies in maintenance practices or the need for better parts management.
recommendations: Conduct a cost-benefit analysis of maintenance practices
Negotiate better rates with parts suppliers
business_impact: High maintenance costs can reduce profitability and affect the overall financial health of the airline.
